comments.body: I remember this app being circulated even in my first year, glad to see it is still there lmao
Yaa free Netflix it was supposed to give ðŸ˜‚.
But in my class it was serious, a girl opened it during math class, and she started crying bitterly, coz she couldn't stop it...

Lol this happened in my class, and thankfully  the teacher was a ds teacher , she knew it wasn't his  faultðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜­,but i still dont get it, doesnt the app require some settings permissions to override do not disturb?

Playing media doesn't really depend on Do Not Disturb. All it does is keep increasing the volume to max and starts moaning like shit. I fished through the app's files and realised that the app doesn't even have an Indian origin, it's Chinese. The scripts were compiled .Lua files, so i couldn't read them.

Edit: Who's a ds teacher?
Data structures teacher, ds is a course in 2nd year
I think you can open lua files in an editor. Lua is a programming language
I know it dude, but the content in the Lua files are encoded in base 64. When I decrypt them, it just returns random non-renderable characters..
Bruh someone sent this in my college's groups too, under the title of 'phys midsem marks' lol
